identificationModule.officialTitle: GORE® Carotid Stent Clinical Study for the Treatment of Carotid Artery Stenosis in Patients at Increased Risk for Adverse Events From Carotid Endarterectomy

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Evaluate the safety and efficacy of the GORE® Carotid Stent for the treatment of carotid artery stenosis in patients at increased risk for adverse events from carotid endarterectomy
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: This is a prospective, multicenter, single-arm clinical study comparing outcomes with the GORE® Carotid Stent to a performance goal derived from carotid endarterectomy outcomes in high-surgical-risk patients.

armGroups.label: Carotid Artery Stenting
armGroups.description: Carotid Artery Stenting with the GORE® Carotid Stent

interventions.name: Carotid Artery Stenting
interventions.description: Carotid Artery Stenting with the GORE® Carotid Stent

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants Who Experienced Major Adverse Events (MAE) at One Year
primaryOutcomes.description: MAE defined as any death, stroke, or myocardial infarction through 30 days post-index procedure, or ipsilateral stroke between 31 days and 1 year (365 days).

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants Who Achieved Stent Technical Success
secondaryOutcomes.description: Stent Technical Success defined as successful implantation of a GORE® Carotid Stent

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants Who Achieved Embolic Protection Device (EPD) Technical Success
secondaryOutcomes.description: EPD Technical Success defined as GORE® Embolic Filter delivered, placed, and retrieved without requiring assisting interventional methods.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants Who Achieved Procedure Success
secondaryOutcomes.description: Procedure Success defined as Stent Technical Success with \< 30% residual stenosis and no in-hospital MAE.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Participants Who Experienced MAE at 30 Days
secondaryOutcomes.description: Defined as any death, stroke, or myocardial infarction through 30 days post-index procedure.
Any cause death through 30 days post-index procedure
Any myocardial infarction through 30 days post-index procedure
Any stroke through 30 days post-index procedure
≥80% diameter stenosis within the stented lesion or within 5 mm proximal or distal to the stent at follow-up evaluation by core lab angiographic analysis
Any clinically driven revascularization procedure that is performed to increase the luminal diameter inside or within 5 mm of the previously treated lesion

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patient is at least 18 years old at informed consent
* Patient is willing and capable of complying with all study protocol requirements, including specified follow-up period and can be contacted by telephone.
* Patient is willing to provide written informed consent prior to enrollment in study.
* Patient is either:

  * Symptomatic with carotid stenosis ≥50% as determined by angiography using NASCET methodology. Symptomatic is defined as amaurosis fugax ipsilateral to the carotid lesion; Transient Ischemic Attack (TIA) or non-disabling stroke within 180 days of the procedure within the hemisphere supplied by the target vessel; OR
  * Asymptomatic with carotid stenosis ≥80% as determined by angiography using NASCET methodology
* Patient must be considered high risk for adverse events during carotid endarterectomy

Note: Additional inclusion criteria may apply

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patient has life expectancy of less than one year.
* Patient is experiencing (or has experienced) an evolving, acute, or recent disabling stroke.
* Patient has anticipated or potential sources of emboli (e.g. atrial fibrillation, known previously symptomatic patent foramen ovale (PFO), mechanical heart valve, or Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT) treated within 6 months).
* Patient has had an acute myocardial infarction within 72 hours prior to the index procedure.
* Patient has a history of major, disabling ipsilateral stroke with residual deficit that may confound the neurological subject assessments.
* Patient has known severe carotid stenosis contralateral to the target lesion requiring treatment within 30 days following the index procedure.

Note: Additional exclusion criteria may apply

references.citation: Gray WA, Levy E, Bacharach JM, Metzger DC, Randall B, Siddiqui A, Schonholz C, Alani F, Schneider PA. Evaluation of a novel mesh-covered stent for treatment of carotid stenosis in patients at high risk for endarterectomy: 1-year results of the SCAFFOLD trial. Catheter Cardiovasc Interv. 2020 Jul;96(1):121-127. doi: 10.1002/ccd.28586. Epub 2019 Nov 11.

measures.title: Ipsilateral Amaurosis Fugax or Transient Monocular Blindness (TMB)
Target Lesion % Diameter Stenosis
measures.description: = (RVD - MLD) / RVD x 100, where RVD = Reference Vessel Diameter (mm) and MLD = Minimum Lumen Diameter (mm)

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants Who Experienced Major Adverse Events (MAE) at One Year
outcomeMeasures.description: MAE defined as any death, stroke, or myocardial infarction through 30 days post-index procedure, or ipsilateral stroke between 31 days and 1 year (365 days).
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Per protocol subjects with 1-year MAE evaluation

groups.title: Carotid Artery Stenting
groups.description:
Carotid Artery Stenting with the GORE® Carotid Stent

Carotid Artery Stenting: Carotid Artery Stenting with the GORE® Carotid Stent

analyses.groupDescription:
Test null hypothesis of equal or greater proportion with 1-year MAE compared to a performance goal (PG).

H0: P ≥ 16.9% vs H1: P \< 16.9%, where P is the true proportion of CAS subjects with 1-year MAE and 16.9% is the PG based on outcomes reported for patients treated with carotid endarterectomy (CEA).

N=280 subjects provide ≥90% power to exclude PG with 95.1% confidence if P=10.2% under H1.
analyses.nonInferiorityComment:
Acceptable performance: favorably exclude PG=16.9% with 95.1% confidence.

Wa = expected weight (proportion) anatomic = 35% Pa = CEA expected anatomic MAE = 11% Wc = expected weight (proportion) comorbid = 65% Pc = CEA expected comorbid MAE = 14% D = noninferiority delta = 4%

PG = 0.35 x 11% + 0.65 x 14% + 4% = 16.9%
analyses.pValueComment: A priori 1-sided alpha = 0.049 (from simulation) to ensure overall type-1 error rate ≤ 0.05.
analyses.estimateComment: Weighted by expected fractions of anatomic and comorbid high risk subjects (35% and 65%, respectively). Standard error based on H0.
